content: शासनं [शास्-ल्युट्] {@--1@} Instruction, teaching, discipline. {@--2@} Rule, sway, government; अनन्यशासनामुर्वी <ls>R. 1. 30</ls>; so अप्रतिशासन. {@--3@} An order, a command, direction; तरुभिरपि देवस्य शासनं प्रप्ताणीकृतं <ls>Ś. 6</ls>; <ls>R. 3. 69</ls>, <ls n="R.">14. 83</ls>, <ls n="R.">18. 28.</ls> {@--4@} An edict, enactment, a decree. {@--5@} A precept, rule. {@--6@} A royal grant (of land &c.), charter; अहं त्वां शासनशतेन योज यिष्यामि <ls>Pt. 1</ls>; <ls>Y. 2. 240</ls>, <ls n="Y. 2.">295.</ls> {@--7@} A deed, writing, written agreement. {@--8@} Control of passions. {@--9@} A written book of authority. (At the end of <ab>comp.</ab> शासन often means ‘punisher, destroyer, killer’; as in स्मरशासनः, पाकशासनः).
